poem:
**Solingen Night**

The festival lights,
hushed by sirens,
echo through cobblestone streets.

In the dark, 
an unknown hand 
scribes grief 
on the faces of strangers.

Three lives severed—
a cruel tally 
at the hour 
when stars kindle,
reminding us
how fragile this night.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Solingen stabbings: what we know so far A manhunt is under way after three people were killed in a mass stabbing at a festival in Solingen in Germany on Friday night. Here is what we know so far: Three people have been killed and eight injured in a knife attack at a diversity festival in the west German city of Solingen, police said. Witnesses alerted police shortly after 9.30pm last night to an unknown attacker". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
